summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to colleagues, discussing a discovery question in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It references a recent court opinion from Judge Nathan denying further discovery on the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) but ordering the government to confirm in writing its disclosure obligations regarding exculpatory evidence. The sender plans to draft a letter and requests a call to discuss.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued an opinion denying further discovery on the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, but ordered the government to confirm its disclosure obligations regarding exculpatory evidence.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email and the criminal case. The discussion centers on discovery obligations and evidence related to her defense, specifically regarding the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is drafting a letter to the court regarding discovery obligations in the Maxwell case and seeking to discuss the matter with colleagues.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Prosecutor for the government in the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, responsible for handling discovery and disclosure obligations.
Presiding judge in Ghislaine Maxwell's case, issuing rulings on discovery matters including the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

events.title: Judge Nathan Issues Opinion on NPA Discovery
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an opinion denying further discovery on the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) but ordered the government to confirm in writing within one week its views on disclosing any evidence material to Maxwell's defense under the NPA.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Government Letter to Judge Nathan on Discovery
events.description: The government sent a letter to Judge Nathan outlining what they were and were not going to do with other agency files in the Maxwell case.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Judge Nathan denied further discovery on the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The court ordered the government to confirm in writing within one week whether it views any evidence supporting Maxwell's interpretation of the NPA as material it is required to disclose.
The government prosecutor is drafting a letter in response to the court's order and seeking to discuss the matter with colleagues.
The email references a prior letter from October 2020 where the government outlined its handling of other agency files in the case.
